modules.description: Provides functions to parse and manage glossary entries, including parsing a file into a list of strings, initializing a glossary, and extracting name-definition pairs. Operates on strings, hashtables, and file paths to build and validate glossary data. Used to generate HTML representations of glossaries and check for the presence of valid entries.

Generates HTML from a parsed AST, including numbered tables of content and structured body elements. Processes TeX files by converting sections, chapters, and subsections into HTML with customizable chapter starting points. Constructs complete HTML pages by integrating titles, styles, and content into a single output.

Generates LaTeX commands from a name and parameter list, and constructs full LaTeX content from parsed mathematical structures. Recalculates environments to ensure proper alignment and equation formatting. Used to dynamically produce web-compatible math expressions from structured input.

Parses LaTeX strings into an abstract syntax tree, handling commands, math expressions, and structured elements like sections and environments. It processes character lists to extract commands, arguments, and nested structures, transforming them into a typed representation. It separates preambles, reads metadata, and organizes document sections into a coherent structure.

Provides string comparison, transformation, and file I/O operations. Works with strings, character lists, and file paths. Enables checking string prefixes, converting text to character sequences, and reading/writing files line by line.

Processes TeX files to extract titles, glossaries, and content, converting them into structured HTML. Operates on custom data types representing document metadata and parsed TeX content. Used to generate HTML chapters for online publishing on platforms like ScribbleHub.

Processes LaTeX content into structured data, generates HTML and LaTeX output, and manages glossaries through parsing, transformation, and file operations. Handles abstract syntax trees, mathematical expressions, and document sections, with support for customizing HTML layouts and validating glossary entries. Converts strings to character lists, extracts metadata, and writes files line by line. Constructs web-compatible math expressions, builds tables of contents, and ensures proper formatting in generated documents.
